N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 248.4 - Allocation of state financial assistance

State Regulations
(a) The allocation of State financial
assistance shall be based on the following criteria: (1)
methodology to be employed by the
center; (2)
number of individuals
to be served; (3)
variety of
services to be provided; (4)
extent
of involvement of disabled persons in center management and staffing; and
(5)
reasonableness of the
anticipated cost of the project. (b) The agency will allocate funds pursuant
to contracts with eligible centers in accordance with appropriations available
for such purposes and information contained in current project year budget
requests and narrative reports. (c) In the event that the agency determines that a center is not proceeding in a
reasonable fashion to meet its contractual obligations to the agency, the
agency may withhold or recover from the center all or a portion of its
allocated funds. The agency may reallocate such funds to other eligible
centers. Notes
